title: Florida Medicaid
shortDescription: Florida's state Medicaid program covering autism services for eligible children and families.
description: Florida Medicaid provides comprehensive healthcare coverage for eligible low-income families, children, pregnant women, elderly individuals, and people with disabilities. For children with autism, Florida Medicaid covers essential services including Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), speech therapy, occupational therapy, and other medically necessary treatments. The program is administered by the Florida Agency for Health Care Administration (AHCA) and offers coverage through various managed care plans across the state. Additionally, the iBudget waiver program, administered by the Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD), provides home and community-based services for Floridians with developmental disabilities including autism.
benefits: Includes speech, occupational, and physical therapy
No or low-cost coverage for eligible families
Covers durable medical equipment when needed
iBudget waiver for additional home/community services
eligibility: Eligibility is based on income, family size, and other factors. Children may qualify through various pathways including family income limits, disability status, or foster care. Income limits vary by program category.
howToApply: Apply online through the MyACCESS portal, in person at a local Department of Children and Families office, or by calling the Florida Medicaid hotline. You will need proof of income, identity, residency, and citizenship or immigration status.
